definition: something that foreshadows a future event : something that gives an anticipatory sign of what is to come
examples: robins, crocuses, and other harbingers of spring

definition: one that initiates a major change : a person or thing that originates or helps open up a new activity, method, or technology : pioneer
examples: the great legal harbinger of the New Deal revolution
the harbingers of peace to a hitherto distracted … people

definition: a person sent ahead to provide lodgings
to give a warning or prediction of : to be a harbinger (see harbinger entry 1) of
